Key Arguments: The Bill lacks clear definitions for 'misinformation' and 'disinformation', which could lead to misuse of power.
The legislation could silence dissenting voices and challenge democratic principles.
Existing laws already protect against serious threats, making the new legislation unnecessary.
The Bill could lead to a less respectful society by silencing voices rather than fostering open dialogue.
Notable Quotes: This puts a lot of power in the hands of whoever is enforcing the law.
Preventing Australian citizens from expressing their views concerns me as it seems to push us away from democracy and towards dictatorship style government.
I don't see this Bill as something that will lead to a more respectful society, I just see it leading to silencing voices.
